results.title: Simvastatin suppresses apoptosis in vulnerable atherosclerotic plaques through regulating the expression of p(53), Bcl-2 and Bcl-xL.
results.text_hl: Moreover, we found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ administration led to reduced TUNEL-positive cells in the @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Root_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000094628 @@@aortic root lesions@@@, accompanied by up-regulation of @GENE_BCL2 @GENE_12043 @@@Bcl-2@@@ and @GENE_BCL2L1 @GENE_12048 @@@Bcl-xL@@@ expression, and decreased @GENE_TRP53_PS @GENE_22060 @@@P(53)@@@ expression as shown by Western blot.

citations.NLM: Qin W, Lu Y, Zhan C, Shen T, Dou L, Man Y, Wang S, Xiao C, Bian Y, Li J. Simvastatin suppresses apoptosis in vulnerable atherosclerotic plaques through regulating the expression of p(53), Bcl-2 and Bcl-xL. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 2012 Feb;26(1):23-30. PMID: 22038096
citations.BibTeX: @article{22038096, title={Simvastatin suppresses apoptosis in vulnerable atherosclerotic plaques through regulating the expression of p(53), Bcl-2 and Bcl-xL.}, author={Qin W and Lu Y and Zhan C and Shen T and Dou L and Man Y and Wang S and Xiao C and Bian Y and Li J}, journal={Cardiovasc Drugs Ther}, volume={26}, number={1}, pages={23-30}}

results.title: Pitfalls in the assessment of murine atherosclerosis.
results.text_hl: This review provides examples of the fact that different procedures for the measurement of @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@ in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ may lead to interpretation of the extent of @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@ having markedly different biological and clinical significance for @SPECIES_9606 @@@humans@@@: 1) aortic @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ measurement is highly sensitive for the detection of early and advanced @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis lesions@@@, but misses the identification of the location and complexity of these lesions that are so critical for @SPECIES_9606 @@@humans@@@; 2) the histological analysis of the @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Root_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000094628 @@@aortic root lesions@@@ in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated and control @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ reveals similar lesion morphology in spite of the remarkable @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-induced reduction of the aortic @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol_Esters @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002788 @@@cholesteryl ester@@@ content; 3) in histological analyses, chemical fixation and inclusion may extract the tissue fat and also shrink and distort tissue structures.

citations.NLM: Catanozi S, Rocha JC, Passarelli M, Chiquito FC, Quintão EC, Nakandakare ER. Pitfalls in the assessment of murine atherosclerosis. Braz J Med Biol Res. 2009 Jun;42(6):471-5. PMID: 19448893
citations.BibTeX: @article{19448893, title={Pitfalls in the assessment of murine atherosclerosis.}, author={Catanozi S and Rocha JC and Passarelli M and Chiquito FC and Quintão EC and Nakandakare ER}, journal={Braz J Med Biol Res}, volume={42}, number={6}, pages={471-5}}

results.title: Allergic asthma aggravated atherosclerosis increases cholesterol biosynthesis and foam cell formation in apolipoprotein E-deficient mice.
results.text_hl: These results indicate that @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ biosynthesis is increased during acute @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ uptake and foam cell formation is increased during advanced @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ administration significantly ameliorated the @<m>DISEASE_Aortic_Root_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000094628 @@@aortic root lesion@@@ size of @DISEASE_Status_Asthmaticus @DISEASE_MESH:D013224 @@@asthmatic@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ and significantly decreased @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_15357 @@@HMGCR@@@ and CD36 expression.

citations.NLM: Gao S, Wang C, Li W, Shu S, Zhou J, Yuan Z, Wang L. Allergic asthma aggravated atherosclerosis increases cholesterol biosynthesis and foam cell formation in apolipoprotein E-deficient mice. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2019 Nov 19;519(4):861-867. PMID: 31558320
citations.BibTeX: @article{31558320, title={Allergic asthma aggravated atherosclerosis increases cholesterol biosynthesis and foam cell formation in apolipoprotein E-deficient mice.}, author={Gao S and Wang C and Li W and Shu S and Zhou J and Yuan Z and Wang L}, journal={Biochem Biophys Res Commun}, volume={519}, number={4}, pages={861-867}}
